answers.answer: I did, but not near as bad. I was put on bed rest due to high blood pressure and was watch very closely for preclamcia. Be very careful. It its preclamcia and gets worse you can go into seziures.

Thank you! They didn't even consider preeclampsia as I never had high blood pressure throughout the pregnancy  (not even yesterday during that episode). Very odd, but good to know I need to watch out for it.

I was going to say that those all sound like symptoms of pre-eclampsia, which does not require a high blood pressure I don't think.  You just usually have high blood pressure with it, but the key is if you have protein in your urine. If any of the symptoms come back make sure you call your doctor asap.
one Of my friends had similar symptoms & it turned out she had bells palsy

Thanks guys! They tested my urine too and they found no sign of pre-eclampsia.. So odd. My OB said she'll induce me if it happens again though as it's not symptoms you want to see in a pregnant woman!

question: I'm 38 weeks and just spent 24 hours at the L&B for having "stroke-like" symptoms. Yesterday I started seeing blurry from one eye with strong numbness in my hand. What followed was the scariest though as my speech got slurred, I was totally unable to form sentences! I've had these optic migraines kind of symptoms a few times in the past few weeks but it's the first time my speech got slurred so my doctor recommended I head to the ER. They did a million tests and I'm neurologically perfect so they couldn't put a final diagnosis on it. I feel good just tired and thankfully baby is 100% OK! Anyone experience this during their pregnancy? I'm frustrated they were unable to find out what it was though obviously I'm thankful all seems OK :)
title: Blurred vision, numbness & slurred speech!
